text: Had combination pho and bun bo hue at Pho King. The pho was good and bun bo hue was at its best so far and could be better if they add a bit more meat in their soup. Such a nice place to be back.

Pho joints are getting a little too numerous these days and it's hard to make yourself stand out in the crowd. Well, they Pho King did it. Came for 12:30 lunch on a Sunday with my 8 y/o daughter, and was seated immediately, which was lucky because by 1pm there was a waitlist. The place is small but airy, extremely clean, and modern. For my first time, I ordered the dac biet special pho, it was $9.95. They only serve one size bowl and it's a Small by comparison to most other places. It's fairly standard, brisket, flank, tendon, beef balls, and rare steak. Tripe is not on the menu, I thought this would be a red flag, but it turns out the broth was very nice, very clean tasting with a deep beefy flavor. The noodles had a good chew and didn't seem to water down the soup. Standard pho veggie accoutrements were average. The meats were tender and flavorful, but lacking in portion. Service was prompt and courteous, check service at the table which is very nice compared counter POS. 

Overall, it's a good bowl of pho, not great, but it might be the best in that area at Eastern and 215.

Great place..  Clean, spacious and delicious food.. I got the Pho Dac Biet and I was given a lot of meat,  noodles and soup! Broth was tasty and not watered down. Will definitely come back here.  They also have us 20% off for grand opening and free flan. Delish. 

Servers were very attentive and quick to ask your questions or concerns.  Also very good with topping off your drinks.  
Will definitely go back here again.  


Ambience: casual
Food: delicious 
Service: fast,  attentive and great
I am so happy with the service, the price and most of all FOOD IS REALLY PHOKING GOOD.  Don't go anywhere else for PHO. This PLACE is EXCELLENT in all aspects.
Great food, good price, good service, clean. I had beef vermicelli it was delicious, all the appetizers were great too!
Sunday pho with rare steak on the side , perfect and great serving, will be back again with more people to support , less than 10$$ with grand opening dissscounttttt
Food was good and staff was nice. Portions was light weight but will eat there again.

Came here with my son after a cold rainy day. We both were craving something warm. The staff quickly took care of us. We had the Pho with 3 meats. Mmmm everything was perfect! The broth was the tastiest I've had in a long time. I can't wait to have it again!!

After a long weekend of drinking in Vegas I had to get my Pho fix.  I was staying in Green Valley area so this place popped up on the search.  Place is nicely decorated and all seemed clean.  You should look for that when eating at Asian restaurants.  On the menu you can select what kinds of meat you want in your Pho (build your own), along with their special oxtail Pho.  Loving oxtail I ordered that one.  The broth was a bit salty but not overpowering.  Food was really good I finished the whole thing.  I would definitely come back just for that cause not many places have oxtail Pho.

This review is only for the Bun Bo Hue. Always ordered to go, but the staff seems very nice. First impression: the soup is incredibly oily with a thick floating layer of orange grease, but somehow it had no flavor, complexity, or spice. All I tasted was oil, even after I tried stirring to get to the broth. It was almost inedible. However, the tendons were absolutely perfect, gelatinous and tender, so I gave it another shot. Second time around, I asked the kitchen for less oil. Once I got home, I skimmed off the top layer of orange grease using a spoon. I added two lime slices, basil, additional chili sauce, and a squirt of hoisin. It was incredible!! I think reviewers who are commenting the broth is flavorless is drinking the soup as it comes. It needs some doctoring, but my experience the second time was outstanding, and I am now addicted.
Spoke with management and confirmed that the pricing error was mine, therefore I added a fourth star.

This place is really good. The broth is amazing, hard to find for sure. Low msg, good small cozy location. Great service and very clean. The broth is so tasty you can skip the hoisin sauce and siracha/chili paste. Portion is decent, a little more meat wouldn't hurt. Simple menu, one size pho bowl.

Second best pho spot in Henderson. Pho Mailan is still my favorite. 

Pho is darker than normal, but doesn't lack flavor. Friendly service. Kinda stingy on bean sprouts. Definitely will be back!
This new restaurant is great, you get the great Vietnamese food with exceptional customer service. Also this place is down the street from my place, well be visiting often.

If you don't want to leave the Henderson area for some Vietnamese food, this new place is a nice choice. The pho broth is light but had just enough flavor and a hint of lime. And I appreciate the fact that when I asked for extra limes, they weren't stingy with it. For less than $10, the portion is great. Lots of noodles and the meat portion was just right. The spot is spacious and clean and the service was quick but this was a slower time in the day. Anyway, I would recommend stopping by and giving the place a shot
Place is nice , but the food you order isn't the same way it comes out when ordered like all other viet restaurants, prepare for a surprise
We love the pho at Pho King! This place is clean and the food is really, really good. A must try

Pho was just ok. It's a bit pricey for a bowl of Pho .$9.25 to $10.99 . The broth is a bit bland. It is definitely not authentic Vietnamese Pho . The soup broth is too dark.I haven't tried any other dishes but it's not for me . 
Service was great and the store is clean .

I love this place!! The food is amazing, great portions for great prices. The staff is always polite and just all around great people, and they always pull through. last week I came in for lunch and had lost my debit card and was horribly embarrassed, they were very helpful and payed my meal for me. I will definitely be back again with a huge tip to repay you!!

Been to several Pho places in Vegas.  This place is by far the best!! Very clean place, friendly waiters.  My husband is a "Pho addict".  As for me I love it myself, twice a month is good for me.  As for my husband, I think he would go crazy without it!  So we both know what is really good tasting Pho.  The best Pho we had was in a restaurant back home in Honolulu, called Pho To Chau.  Although Pho To Chau is our number one Pho place, Pho King comes in number 2.  Broth is perfect, lots of everything that comes with it.  I love adding lime to it, and lots of basil.  Get an order of the egg rolls on the side, very delicious!  Love this place!! Highly recommend!!

This has become my go to pho spot on the south side of town. I come for lunch a few days a week passing other pho places to get here.  

The pho broth is really good here and the rice dishes are the best I have had in vegas. 

Service is fast and friendly everytime.

Perhaps I'm a little spoiled...I miss eating Pho on Chicago's Argyle street...this place was clean, service was great... the soup base was clean but no umph factor.  My friend fr Canada said the same thing.  The others loved the crispy egg rolls.
Great little pho place!   We had a combination pho with brisket, meatballs and steak.   It was wonderful however it could have been a little more flavorful

After my drive out to Vegas, I was craving for vietnamese food. Found this place and headed straight here before checking into my hotel. 

I arrived around 12/1230 and it wasn't too busy, so I was seated right away. I was craving pho, but went for their rice dish instead. Lol. I ordered the com bo luc lac. Food didn't take too long to arrive. The dish was missing fish sauce! Instead they serve salt, pepper, and lime for the dipping sauce which I am not used to. So I had to ask for a side of fish sauce in order for my meal to be complete. The meal was not too bad. The beef was tender, juicy, and tasty. I enjoyed the dish and even finished it! 

Service was good. Everyone there is friendly. With the yelp check in, I received a 10% discount on the bill and the meals are not too pricey.
Amazing service! Everybody working there is so friendly and the flank pho I had was very good. Big portions :)
The food and service are excellent. Have eaten at Pho King several times and the quality is consistent. Spicy rare steak is my favorite! Definitely recommend.

It was different, and my husband and I enjoyed it. The chicken pho came with two fairly large cooked chicken breasts instead of shredded chicken. The sauce they used on it was a nice added touch. The portion size of the broth was also generous and enjoyable. Even though I did take away I had great service while I waited. They immediately offered me water and even let me know the boba shop next door had my favorite smoothie.

I recently moved to the east side of the I-15, so it was nice finding a Vietnamese restaurant closer to me compared to the Spring Mtn. rd. area. I ordered the Chicken pho and my friend ordered pho with brisket and rare steak. It was all pretty underwhelming. My order came with a bowl of noodles and broth with 2 grilled chicken breasts on the side. I've never had chicken pho like this, and don't think I'd order it again. I tried the broth to my friend's pho and wasn't very flavorful. 

My one positive takeaway is their waitstaff; they were friendly and attentive. I will try this place again and order a rice dish instead.

Honestly, when you call yourself "King", I expect a very good bowl of pho.   I can name quite a few restaurants off the top of my head with the ability to usurp the throne.  In fact, without the check-in discount for the grand opening, I cannot say there's much value here at all.

The pho dac biet/combination pho I ordered seemed lacking.   The tendons were very small. 
 They could have been more generous with their portioning of their flank steak and probably their noodles as well.  The broth did not stand out in any way. 

The fresh spring rolls we had as an appetizer were okay.  Their accompanying peanut sauce was way too watery.  

My wife's pork chop dish was pretty good and better than the pho.   

They'll have to step up and prove to everyone in the future that they deserve the name 'Pho King'.   Right now, they're acting more like the 'Rook'ie.

Really delicious!
Relaxing interior, will definetly return.
Family owned authentic Pho resturant!

This is probably my favorite vietnamese restaurant in town. The bun bo hue is so delicious along with other dishes. The place is so neat and clean, services is excellent. I will definitely coming back to try some other good stuffs.

If its a nice hot tasty bowl of authentic Vietnamese pho you're craving, head straight over to Pho King! There is a vast array of meats to choose from for your soup. We also tried the Bun style rice noodle dish with bbq pork which was fantastic. To top it off, service is always fast and polite.

This place is pho-king amazing!! Service was pho-nomenal!! With all jokes aside, food was great (one of best pho I had and I am from bay area, so that says a lot) and place was clean. Will be back when I come to vegas!!

New kids on the block. Had the pho and it didn't disappoint. I really enjoyed it and I noticed that the broth was very clean and not too oily. Just feels a little dirty after you finish your pho and your broth is full of oily circles. None of that here!

The service was very friendly. It's a new place so it's a little expected but still I was delighted that the server was very attentive and helpful. It's always good to see more pho restaurants on this side of town. Haven't tried more than their pho so I'm planning to return and try some of their other selections.

came here today for lunch and ordered the Oxtail Pho and nem nuong. wasn't very impressed with their oxtail pho as their noodles tasted straight out of the package. But their nem nuong were really good and tasty though!
Vermicelli pork soup was really good, definitely me and my husband will come back for more!!!

Clever name but names can be deceiving. They aren't the king of anything. Decent food but nothing spectacular. Their pho broth is just okay, I prefer Pho Saigon 8's broth. The pho is more pricey than other places, and the quality is much better in other places. Service was okay and the servers were polite. There are so many better pho places on Eastern that they need to really pick up their game if they really want to live up to their name as Pho King.

I do not fancy myself a "foodie" or a food snob of any kind.

Having spent lots of time in Viet Nam, and never having pho prior to going there, I came home to Vegas searching for a place that could even slightly come close to the pho I had over there.

I judge pho mainly on the broth.
So far, Pho King is the closest thing to the real deal that I've found on this side of town in Henderson. I know there are tons of pho places, and I've tried maybe 10 of them. 
The only other one that I love is Sunflower Vietnamese Restaurant all the way in N. Las Vegas on Craig road.

I would definitely, definitely recommend trying this place if you're looking for legit, authentic tasting pho. They also have Cafe Sua Da there, the Vietnamese coffee made with condensed milk, and they even used the old-school drip system like they still do in Viet Nam. I took one sip and it was like omg I'm back in Viet Nam. It was awesome.

The place is in a super convenient location, and the owner is very sweet and very enthusiastic about sharing Vietnamese food and culture. He went to Viet Nam to get the paintings that decorate the walls in the restaurant, and everything is very modern and nice in there. The wait staff is very friendly and it's super affordable! My fiance and I had the egg rolls (which were really yummy too), 2 bowls of pho and a cafe sua da and it was like $29 after taxes.

I can't imagine you'd be disappointed trying this place!

I was very happy with my experience and will definitely return. I was first drawn here because they have a vegeterian/ vegan option available. At first when my Pho came out I thought they had my order wrong, because I saw shrimp and meat inside, but to my surprise after asking the waiter it was meatless and tasty!

I'm Vietnamese so I'm super picky with my food. But this so far has the best bun bo hue I ever had beside in Vietnam. And their shrimp roll paste thing( I honestly not sure what they called) is also great. Service is great, usually when I go in an Asian restaurant, I expected to be treated like crap, but their service is better than I expected. Definitely recommended. Give them a try, you'll love it.

Yummy yummy yummy!! We started with the egg rolls, and they have to be the best egg rolls I've had in the city. We then ate our main course, pho, which was super delicious. Not only did the food taste good, but the presentation of the food is beautiful. 


I also have to mention how awesome the customer service was. We came in on 10/26 around 4:45 PM, I didn't catch their names, but there was two young gentlemen and they both were very attentive. Thank you guys! You are awesome!

Tried this place as it was close to home and my friends had a taste for Pho.  It was ok, I have tasted better Pho.  New place on Eastern very small dining area.  I had the beef rice plate, rice was mushy and beef flavor was ok. I don't think I would go back again.

In a town that is already struggling to compete with itself and of course Southern California where the Vietnamese food is unbeatable, it's very difficult for a new pho restaurant to stand out on its own hence why you have places like Pho Saigon 8 who have the formula down right and are currently on their 3rd location which is doing extremely well.

I've lived in Vegas for 5 years now and I know where all the good (and bad - DO NOT go to Pho 87) Pho restaurants are. That being said, I've also only lived in this area of town. The two pho places that stand out are Pho Saigon 8 and Pho Little Saigon...and of course you have Pho MaiLan and Lemongrass Cafe which are "ok". Pho Saigon does well because of its name and because of its location (close to the freeway and LVAC. Pho Little Saigon has the unfortunate problem of being in a location that is slightly difficult to navigate through but I equally enjoy that location as I do Pho Saigon 8.

Pho King is in a better location and has two routes of access which makes it easier (and less of a hassle) to go to than Pho Saigon 8 AND it is in close proximity to EOS Fitness. With that being said, i only tried the pho there and I can say that it unfortunately wasn't my favorite...also, when I'm in a Vietnamese restaurant, I would prefer to hear Vietnamese music and I believe they were just playing a top 40 hits radio station. 


I would say that I would give it another try but with so many other options close by, I don't see myself going back anytime soon :(

Was excited to try this new place!!!  My girls are pescatarian so it was great to see that they have a vegan option for soup.  I really wanted to to like this place but after $48 (with tip for 3 people) it was not really good.  The pho broth was cloudy, no fresh thinly sliced onions and the basil and sprouts looked like they were left from another table.  My daughter's grilled shrimp rice dish with 1 egg ($12 for less than 10 pieces of small shrimp) didn't look good either.  Won't be coming back to this place.
Pho King is the best restaurant in Las Vegasfood was good with awesome service we love it! Will come back next time definitely.

I had this bookmarked for a while and came here for dinner with a Vietnamese friend. The interior is not that big, though it is very sleek and clean, complete with water wall at the entrance.

The menu is not that big. The food was tasty, but definitely modified I think for more general appeal (my broken rice dish did not come with the stringy pork with the gelatin and powder, the combination pho does not have tripe). I enjoyed the oxtail pho broth and the food overall, but just felt that the prices were a bit higher and the food not quite as hardcore authentic as I personally enjoy.

Nonetheless, service was great and it is overall a very nice restaurant.

Yes finally a good vietnamese place on my side of town.  This joint reminds me of hole in the walls that my parents use to take me on our weekly trips to little saigon in Cali.  The food is great, it comes to your table fast, and they pour the coffee strong.  Everything is on point here and the price is a great number.  Whenever I need to get my comfort food meter filled our to recover from a nasty hangover you will find me at Pho King.  Keep doing great things, I will keep coming back

Thought I had written a review for Pho King but not yet...so here it goes..

Yes!  Another Pho shop that has good broth and ingredients.  I got the Bun Bo Hue and it did not disappoint.  I liked that they brought out this delicious umami lemongrass paste to add into my soup to my heart's desire.  The meats and blood cake were all tasty and full of flavor.  I also tried the oxtail pho soup and that again, was flavorful.  For soups, broth is the base and that will determine whether it will be a good bowl of soup or not.  Pho King got it right.  I also liked the fact that they had the top American pop videos playing on their tv...I enjoyed the authentic Vietnamese food, chilled ambiance and the attentive servers here at Pho King and I will return.

I am a pho snob. Yes, it's true. And Pho Kim Long is the ruler by which I measure all pho (the soup, not the service). 

Don't let the ambiance or decor fool you. Now, they just opened up a week ago, so who knows what's yet to come. But I'm hoping maybe they'll throw in some music and maybe not play a random football game on the one tv they have. 

Anyway, the star of the show is the pho. The broth is flavorful--it rivals the 24-hour broth that I love so much at Pho Kim. And the noodles are soft and comforting. Plus, I love that there's an option to "create your own bowl" so I could pick the meats that I wanted.

The service is attentive and friendly, which definitely puts this place ahead. This will for sure be our new pho spot!

I ordered the grill pork plate and the pork was really tasty!   My wife ordered the chicken pho and the chicken was very moist and not dry as we have experienced at other pho restaurants.   

The ambiance was very relaxing with the Vietnamese music video on their TV and the place is very clean looking!  The interior wall was nicely decorated with the Vietnamese pictures and the front entrance was very inviting with the waterfall sign.  Each table was also nicely furnished with all the condiments to enhance your dining experience.   

The service staff was also very pleasant  and helpful with any questions you might have.

Only reason I gave it a four star is I hope they would extend their menu and include some type of sandwich item to round out their menu.

Overall, definitely I would recommend everyone to give them a try.

Yes ,  I am going here and try Pho and Bun Bò Hu this is my second time trying,it's because I want to make sure my comment was right.
Pho oxtails was ok and the broth was the same with other Vietnamese else in Vegas , the taste was not that great and it was good for American only.

Bún bò Hu soups base wasn't taste good lots of fattening and no flavor 

But the sauces for clear spring rolls was better compare with other Vietnamese restaurant I have been in Vegas .

It is just another same not good Vietnamese restaurant in Vegas again ... 

May be I am a picky Vietnamese chef so that is y I can't rate this high sorry

Clean place, good customer service, decent food & offered lots of veggie which is a plus! I had their egg rolls (very crunchy & freshly made), grilled pork rolls are excellent, & decent pho. Their menu is limited but it works since im such an indecisive person. I definitely will come again & try their shaken beef!

Forgot to take the pho's before picture, so here is the pho's after picture lol
My first time here and will be the only place I would go to whenever I'm craving for a bowl of pho... it's sooooo good!!! The broth is everything.

I'm so glad this place came to Henderson. There is a lack of Asian food on this side of town and I'm glad I don't have to drive far just to have a good bowl of pho.

Their menu isn't full of a ton of Vietnamese food so it was easy to read but they also didn't have vegetable pho on the menu, which I always order. But I asked our server and they were able to accommodate that for me. He also made sure that I was ok with the beef broth since I ordered mine with all veggies.

We started with the spring rolls, yummy. It reminded me of lumpia but with a Vietnamese twist. It tastes good if you wrap the spring roll in the lettuce. If you haven't done that before... you are missing out!

My vegetable pho tasted great, I almost never finish all of my food but this time I did! And there was only one size for pho and it was a pretty decent size.

Service was quick, inside was nice & clean as expected for a new restaurant. They gave us a 20% off for their grand opening, so awesome!

Pho with Rare steak at this place is so addictive. I eat at many other places but this place makes the best Pho in town yall. Dont take my word for it but come and try out yourself. I guarantee you wont be disappointed.Their pho recipe is so authentic that nowhere else in this town can compare. Pho broth smell very delish and has flavorful taste that makes you want to drink every last drip of it.They have very high quality meat. Everything is supper fresh. The place is very clean and service is very fast, you dont have to wait too long for your foods. Servers are very attentive. They welcome you at the door and get you seated immediately. Your food will be served to you fresh and hot couple minutes after they took your order. Im definitely coming back to try other dishes on their menu.

Nothing particularly good nor bad about this place.  I won't return as it's average at best.  

Broth is no big deal and the noodles were overcooked.

I feel so apathetic about this business that I almost don't want to write this review, but I'll do it anyway.

Pho King is a new Vietnamese restaurant that has popped up in an increasingly popular section of Eastern Avenue south of 215. They're in the corner of the EOS Fitness plaza, right next to one of my favorite poke bowl spots, so I've seen their signage, laughed at their name, and eagerly looked forward to their opening. When their grand opening weekend finally arrived a couple of weeks ago, I jumped at the chance

I ordered the Com Bo Luc Lac ($12.50), a popular dish commonly referred to as "shaking beef" in English. I was already concerned by the lack of tomato rice and fish sauce-based dipping sauce, and the dish indeed lacked flavor. Some restaurants can pull off getting enough flavor in the beef that you don't need anything else, but this isn't one of them. The other warning sign for me was how quickly the dish was brought out. Although they did sear the beef cubes well, they only got most of the cubes to a rare cook at best. Oh, and the white rice was discernibly on the mushy side.

I also tried a bit of my friend's Pho Dac Biet ($9.75) and immediately decided that I wasn't very interested in having any more to do with it. The broth of beef pho should be complex, but it simply wasn't anything special. Hopefully, he'll get around to writing his full review on that soon.

I've had opportunities to try Pho King again during the remainder of their 20% off promotion (which they ran from the start and extended through the end of October), but I've passed on them. With the full prices in effect, I can't envision myself coming back to try anything else unless I get really bored of all the other new businesses while simultaneously getting recommendations from people who have more experience with Vietnamese food than just the relatively lackluster stuff around Las Vegas.

We enjoyed your restaurant 2+ times a week since November with friendly staff, food served as ordered, great taste, etc. However, the past 2x once as dine-in and another take out. The service during dine in was honestly terrible from a server who was excellent on many other visits. The take out was a disaster, we had 3 entrée orders and spring roll order. One entrée was very good, another was very average and the 3rd was horrific. The spring rolls we ordered were not the ones we took home. It has been a few weeks since we have been to your restaurant and considering going to another Vietnamese restaurant on Spring Mountain this week.  Hopefully your restaurant returns to the high standards we received on our visits in November, December and January.

OK......so I went in today to try their grilled chicken Pho.....WHAT A  MISTAKE!   The broth was so loaded with Anise (the little black star herb that is used in moderation in most pho's) that it was inedible. It had also soaked into the noodles giving them the same wretched taste.
My friend tried the pho tai......and it was the same situation. Both bowls were left on table without eating anything!!! I go to most of the pho  restr.  in the area and also Spring Street and have NEVER had to leave due to the food being so bad.

On the plus side, it is a very clean and orderly establishment  and the server was friendly.
UPDATE:  In response to your reply I submit to you the following:
Yes, my wife and I were the table you mentioned. I had previously been to your establishment and tried your PHO TAI at that time. I found it similar in Anise, however, admittedly not at over whelming as the Pho GA today. Since you talked to your employees I'm sure they mentioned that we left without consuming the pho???  We did not ask for a refund and left your server a tip as well. Perhaps your should sample your broth before throwing the "illegal" word around.

UPDATE 2
Perhaps if you re-read my update you will "comprehend" the review.
We do have the receipt but choose not to take you up on your offer.  
I find it disappointing that you choose to debate over a 1 rating rather than addressing the issue with your kitchen staff.

Wow! I rarely write a review, but had to because this place was sooooooo GOOD! I have gone to dozens of Pho restaurants and this one was the BEST! The service was excellent, the Pho was AMAZING! My husband gets sick if he eats Pho with MSG and he didn't get sick from this place. Also the kitchen and restaurant looked really clean...which is sometimes questionable at a Vietnamese restaurant. Will go there again and again and again! :)

First time here, glad to have something so close. It was really good. Ordered the bun bo hue. Highly recommend. I eat a lot of spicy food so for me this wasn't that spicy but the flavor was aaaamazing. Lots of good beef bits, broth was super flavorful and perfect pairing of veggies. Not use to red cabbage with this soup but it worked so well. Also the shrimp and pork spring rolls were very good. We came in super late 30 mins before they closed, hate doing that but asked before we sat and they were very cordial and welcoming. Sorry guys won't do it again either way.

This is for the food only! 

I was craving some Pho while visiting Vegas and I decided to try this place out since it was highly rated and the pictures looked really good. Mostly it was from the pictures. They looked like the food was legit. So I ordered their combination pho and spring rolls for takeout.  The food was ready in 10-15 min and it was very easy to pick up and get out. After opening all the food back at the house, I tried the broth for the pho. It surprised me! It was the cleanest tasting broth I've ever tasted and I've eaten A LOT of pho. The food was REALLY good. If I ever go back to Vegas, I am definitely going here again!

I finally I have found a super yummy Vietnamese place, and it's by my house! Que my happy dance.  It's crazy because they are every where but often are just mediocre.   Now mind you I have only had their spring rolls and their vermicelli noodle bowls.  I also have only done take out. 

Their vermicelli noodle bowl is what speaks to my soul.   They almost always cook their noodles perfect for one,  while most places overcook them and sometimes even put them steaming hot on your fresh salad ingriendients making them wilt.  None of this blasphemy occurs here.   They also have a good balance of fresh lettuce and pickled veggies to noodle,  and are very generous with meat portions.   I get the grilled pork with a grilled chicken side.   So much flavor it just explodes in the mouth.   The nuoc mam also is not watered down and ties everything together. 

The spring rolls are solid.   They are just well executed, no frills though.  My favorite are still in a hole in the wall in Atlanta,  Georgia. It would be nice to find a place that really elevates these here. 

They are always very fast and curtious when it comes to their to go orders.   Only critique for is for to go they give this squeezy packet of samba ooleck,  not as yummy as the stuff in the rooster bottle.   4 and a half stars over all but I'm rounding up.

Our go to for pho since it's really close to our house. They don't disappoint and the pho bowls are always filling. I love their seafood pho and my husband loves the rare steak pho. Sometimes we supplement our pho bowls with an order of their calamari. My husband adds a side of Tai tea
Parking is never an issue and their bathrooms are usually always clean.

New Pho King place! I had to try it and I'm glad I did.  Walked in and the first decor was a nice looking glass waterfall with the pho king name being displayed and a few art work on the walls.  There is a wall mounted tv showing nonstop music videos the entire time I was there, which is better than white noise or complete quietness. Since it was new and just opened, everything was kept clean and I hope it stays that way.

I ordered the create your own and chose the following three meats- gan(tendon), nam(flank), tai(rare steak).  Noodles were plentiful and the broth was clear with a hint of oily residue.  This shows how much attention they spend creating the broth and skimmy the fat from the boiling broth.  I was stuffed.

Nem nuong cuon was freshly made and the nem was delicious with the crunchy fried rolled skin inside.  The sauce was the basic hoisin with crumble peanuts.

One last note, the hoisin and the siracha bottles were not watered down as I've seen in some restaurants I refuse to visit now.

All in I will be back to try the dry noodles next and then the rice dishes.  Glad more of these places are popping up - I highly suggest giving it a try.

Ordered the Bum bo Hue and ox tail pho. The bum bo hue broth is one of the better ones I've had in this area. I like it because it wasn't oily like other places. What I didn't like was my noodles were undercooked. The meat was a bit dry. My girlfriend got the oxtail pho. I tried the broth it very tasty. The broth was very clear and I felt like it didn't have any msg. The noodles were also undercooked.

Hopefully my second time around will be better.

If you're craving for Pho this is the place to go.  We used to live in Orange County so we had tons of Vietnamese Restaurant option.  When we moved here some of the restaurants around are just average until Pho King opened.  I usually order the diced beef tenderloin and grilled pork patty roll for appetizer.  My husband orders the pho with rare steak. The service is good and they're very friendly.

Nice, clean place; limited menu, fresh ingredients. I went in for something specific and light that I didn't find on the menu, so I asked for a vegetable pho with beef broth, add egg. My order came out relatively quickly and was cool enough to eat right away. The only thing I noticed was that the egg was raw. I thought it would continue to cook in the broth, but it wasn't hot enough, so I didn't get to enjoy the egg; also, I think it was $1.20 charge for one egg addition. I normally go with my man who reminds me to order without onions, but I was visiting from out-of-town, so I forgot; regardless to say, I was picking onions out for the first five or more minutes. I'll know for next time! I would go back probably just ordering an additional egg dish to add eggs into the pho!
Good staff, the pho is a good size and it tastes amazing. They put alot of cilantro and green onion and I like that. I wish they sold thai tea by the gallon...
Been here a couple times. Food has always been great and friendly and fast service. Will be coming back!

I know you want me to say it, so here goes. Let me just say this place is pretty Pho King good. Now that the obligatory pun has been uttered, it's time to get down to business. 

Pho King is the new Vietnamese restaurant in the south side of town, located on the treacherously congested Eastern Ave. It's a small shop with a simple modern flair, topped with a nice little glass pane waterfall at the entrance.

The menu is simple compared to a lot of other pho shops. There are only 5 choices of pho. I opted to create my own bowl and I was allowed to choose three types of meat. I chose the brisket, tendon, and flank. Don't worry, though. If you don't want pho, there are other options on the menu like appetizers, vermicelli, and rice dishes. You know, the standards. 

For the $9.25 price tag, you'd think you wouldn't be getting your money's worth considering all the cheaper options around town, but the bowl they serve you with is pretty large. Well worth the price. They provide plenty of noodles, meats, and garnish. Although I do wish they put more onions into the mixture.

The flavor of the broth was flavorful, and the noodles were cooked just right. I was surprisingly pleased. For a restaurant that has a funny name, their food is no joke.

My favorite pho restaurant here in NV! Probably the only pho I will eat here in Vegas, I've tried other places and this place never fails to satisfy my pho cravings! This place has Great customer service and and food is GREAT! This place reminds me so much of Ha Long in Kalihi, (Hawaii)

There is good pho, then there is Pho King good pho. The broth is darker and more complex than most broths I've had. For that alone the small price increase from the places I usually frequent is worth it.

Top notch!! I was a little hesitated to try them out since its a new restaurant but Im glad I did. The server are very attentive and friendly. I had shaken beef/bo luc lac and vietnamese cafe...true authentic Vietnamese food! Their beef are tender and juicy..not tough/chewy like many other places that I have tried before. Also, the server offered me a bowl of soup which is full of flavor
Definitely Ill come back to try out their Pho. 
-not as many food choices but the food is great.

Always interested in checking out a new joint, I saw their banner from across the street and figured I'd hit them for lunch. Besides, they have motorcycle parking right out front! 

 I found the restaurant clean and inviting.  The staff was friendly and accomodating. The food came out quickly, served fresh and hot. 

The meat was seasoned just right. The noodles weren't my thing, flavorless and on the mushy side, but I got filled up pretty quickly, so just didn't need them,  I guess. 

Overall, typical Pho joint, food-wise. Prices in line with others. Great staff.

Loved it!  Around the Eastern 215 area, we have about 5 or so Pho places.  I have tried them all.  Lemongrass. Pho Mai Lan, Pho Saigon 8, and now Pho King.

Before, Pho Mai Lan was my go to and I am glad to say, that Pho King is now also another favorite.

1.  Great tasting broth!
2.  Clean atmosphere, modern and comforting.
3.  Great Service.
4.  Decent prices.
5.  Bun Bo Hue - Not all Pho places have this and they have it with Pork Hock.
6.  Easy access and parking.
7. Not extremely busy, but constant diners and take out people.
8. Vegan choices for the daughter.

I like this place and will be back for sure!

Our new favorite place for Vietnamese! We had the grilled shrimp vermicelli and the grilled beef vermicelli. The dishes were served in large bowls with a large salad, a generous portion of shrimp and beef over the noodles. We will definitely return soon to try other dishes.

Great flavor in broth good portion on meat and fresh veggies. Meaty egg rolls and service /food felt quick and fresh. I feel a perfect broth should be slight oily-nutty flavor...They do it right! Value is good.
I actually really loved this place, that vegan bowl is AHHMAZING and you could fool anyone with that soy shrimp... jk... can't fake the real deal but it's still soooooo good!

Stopped at this Pho joint right before I hit the road back home to SD. It's really quaint and nice inside. I chose the option to create your own pho which allows you to choose 3 toppings. I got the rare steak, meat balls, and brisket. The broth was so flavorful I could've ate it as is but I like to have an umami flavor to it so I added some fish sauce, spicy chili sate, and lime. I don't like a lot of noodles in my pho and usually have to ask them to put half noodles but it came with just the right amount! They put a lot of meat in their pho which most pho places fail to do; it's always just a lot of broth and noodles. They also use premium Bo vien meat malls here which I like and the steak cuts were really good too. Our server was really attentive and friendly as well. We chatted a bit about my stay here in Vegas and where I was from; very personable and kept it real which I liked! I would definitely recommend this place to try if you're looking to eat some delicious and good quality pho. It was PHO-KING GOOD!

Checked out this restaurant for the very first time and we were greeted and sat immediately. My friends and I had their special with egg noodles and it was very tasty! The broth was excellent! Our waiter was very attentive to our table. I had left the restaurant not realizing that I had left my purse there and when I called them the next morning they confirmed that indeed a "black" purse had been left there. I went back to the restaurant and they had remembered where I had sat and they told me they tried to find me in the parking lot immediately after we had left. I am so grateful and appreciative that they are so honest! My purse was intact with all my belongings! More Blessings to this restaurant, I will be returning for their delicious food and their awesome customer service!

I do love a good bowl of Pho and that's exactly what Pho King serves.  With Pho, it's all about the broth and their broth is bomb. I swear, chicken soup has nothing on the healing and comfort of Pho. 

To stand out with all the great pho info Las Vegas,  you have to win on cleanliness, service and atmosphere. Pho King delivers on all three.  

This is my first time here.  There is something charming, though, about seeing regulars recognized and acknowledged.  Makes me look forward to the next visit.

This place is Pho King good. Say it with me fahkinggood...fuhkinggood. Whatever floats your boat. I've order pho twice here and have been satisfied!  Flavor wise it's just right and they do it a little bit different than other places around town.  The ones that I am used to have more herbs shining through.  Other places are way too salty (pho kim long!).  I like the build your own pho. My favorite is rare steak, beef ball, and brisket. I also have tried the oxtail, which was super tender.  

I like their egg rolls here, whether it is the spring rolls or the nem nuong. Both were delicious, fresh, and wrapped to perfection.

Their menu is more condensed than other Vietnamese restaurants. I wish they had the crispy egg noodle dish with chicken and vegetables in brown sauce!

Servers are really nice here and the restaurant is very clean.

I'm definitely a Pho-natic!!! Saw we had a new spot in the neighborhood and decided to give it a try. Very clean and welcoming interior, even had a bit of music playing. I order my food and experienced the craziest shit I've ever witnessed in a Pho place. GOOD SERVICE!!! Although I certainly don't expect it due to where I'm dining at, but these guys were on point. Broth isn't as "savory" or "robust" as I'm used to. But very tasty. I'll be back.

Clean, organized, uniformed staff.  Very delicious beef broth pho.  The beef rib rice plate didnt look bad either, the best way to order is to share a bowl of pho and order a side of meat!  To try different items.

My 22 year old daughter isn't feeling well so I suggested my go to when I'm sick,  pho. I eat it at least twice a week back home in the bay area. I look on yelp for the closest place ( within 8 miles) with the best reviews.  This was it. It's located in an mostly Asian strip mall.  That was a good sign for me.  It was clean and the staff was friendly. They have a vegan broth that my nephew had and liked.  My beef broth ( they don't do chicken broth) was almost clear. Luckily I added extra basil and cilantro to bring out the flavor . My daughter and nephew liked it. But what do they know about that broth? Lol

I ordered the Spring Rolls, Egg Rolls and Special Pho. My usual go to whenever I visit a Vietnamese restaurant.

They were all fantastic, can't complain at all. I'd recommend anyone to give this place a try, you won't regret it.

Prices are also very reasonable as well.

This is by far the best Vietnamese food I've had on Eastern.  I haven't tried the pho, but the bun (vermicelli bowl) and eggrolls were great.  Iced coffee was excellent as well.  Will definitely be back.  Only downside is the busy interesection to get in and out of the plaza.

Thank you!  Thank you for coming to Henderson.  For years, we had to drive 20+ miles each way, to Chinatown just for decent VN food.  Note, there are about 3 to 4 other VN restaurants within 2 miles of this one but this one blows them out of the water. My son and husband accidentally found this place and they were so excited to tell me about the "fuh-king" good VN restaurant.  I wonder if the owners named the place on purpose but they are certainly living up to their name, literally.  

Try everything because it's good, tasty, authentic VN food.  However, I didn't care for the vegetarian soup, can't remember the name.  They have awesome vegetarian spring rolls, the pho is absolutely delicious, vegetables are always fresh, and the portions are more than fair.  And yes, they are spring rolls in rice paper, not that deep-fried junk you get from other restaurants. Service is EXCELLENT.  The place is clean and I visualize that they will be tearing down walls to expand in the near future because it's really good food.  Just one suggestion, I hope they will turn that television down.  It's kind of annoying and in my opinion, takes away from the dining atmosphere.

Not a bad spot to stop in and grab a bowl of pho.  As is expected with this soup, the portions are huge and the price is low.

To start, we ordered egg rolls for the table, which were crispy outside, and jam packed full of flavor inside.  5 out of 5 stars for the egg rolls.  For lunch, I got the build your own pho with rare steak, brisket, and flank.  The soup itself was sweeter than what I prefer, and the meat was on the fatty side.  Don't get me wrong, I like a chunk of fatty meat in my pho as much as the next guy... but this was a bit much for me; 3 out of 5 stars.Where this restaurant excels is its service.  

Our table never had a glass that was below half full.  We took my four year old daughter with us and were informed that they only have one size bowl of pho.  Fine, no big deal.  When I ordered the kiddo a bowl of soup, the waiter quickly suggested that I order a side of steak and a side of noodles instead which would save a few bucks. Right on!  My daughter loved the broth in the soup so much that she drank all of what was in her bowl.  I ordered a refill on the broth for her, and they brought it out free of charge.  5 out of 5.

I'd say all in all, this is a solid spot for a quick bite if you've got a big appetite and find yourself looking for an inexpensive spot with a great ambiance and staff.

. One of the best Vietnamese restaurants I've been to. It offers variety of food which multicultural people would definitely love to try. A must to try.... The service is definitely the best as they have the best servers.

Flavor was very dull and soup was very salty to the taste. The place was mediocre for the price and was not very appealing. The place didn't give much meat flavor in the soup and the price is expensive for the proportions. The coffee was okay and it's best to ask to have it less sweet if you don't like sweet coffee. So in conclusion, this place is Pho King bad. :)
This is our favorite Pho spot around us. We never get appetizers though as they are over priced for their size.

Pho King by far is the best!
The place is cozy and clean. On top of that their Pho and bbq pork with egg rolls vermicelli and spring rolls appetizers is too die for. 
Everyone here is attentive and friendly. This place is a top notch and very reasonable and that why my friends and neighbors including myself keep coming back. 
Needless to say I would not go anywhere else!
You Rock PHO KING..!
Cozy place, great atmosphere and service. Especially delicious food. Love their steak and eggs for lunch!!! Check out their rice paper salad (banh Trang tron)!!!!!!

Best pho experience I've ever had! Staff was incredibly nice and attentive and they actually took the time to go through the menu with us which was nice because we tried an appetizer that we've never had before (Nem nuong cuon) which was delicious. The Vietnamese coffee is a must try! We will definitely be returning

We accidentally found this Vietnamese restaurant next to EOS Fitness and now Pho King has become our "go to" pho spot in Henderson!  The best part about this place is that you don't walk out smelling like pho!  lol.  

Hubby always orders the Com Bo Luc Lac - diced tenderloin beef stir-fry and I usually get the pork bun.  The only complain I have is that the bun portion is not consistent... sometimes you get lots of vegetables with hardly any noodles and sometimes you get a bunch of noodles with less veggies.  

All in all -- I'm a fan!
Nice Vietnamese rea Tita time close to home. I really like their spring roll water bowl. Super cool

This is probably the best pho in town, 100% home made food!! Fresh, super clean place 
it's a family owned business so the service is awesome!! Price even better!! Must try place.

We ordered our food to go. We ordered the house special Pho which the meat was tough but the broth was good. The spring roll was loose that was messing once you bite into it. The egg roll was ok. I called in my ordered and was informed that my order will be ready in 15min which I got the about that time. My food was not ready for another 15mire minutes, the staff was nice and the restaurant was clean.

Food: pho tai and fried egg rolls. Everything tasted very fresh and I think this is a good option when I don't want to drive to Chinatown to my favorite place (Pho Bosa). 

Service: friendly and checked in on us regularly. 

Cost: fair and was able to use Yelp check in for 10% off. 

Location: in same plaza as Japan Market and next to Poke Poku. 

I really hate the name of this place though!

Pho is my comfort food! I can eat it everyday! The broth here is by far the best I've had. It's flavorful without being over powering & not greasy. The meat to noodle ratio is on point!  love this place!

I love a good bowl of hot steamy pho on a cold day. My usual spot on this side of town is always busy & lacks good customer service, so I stumbled across this restaurant on yelp. Came for lunch and it wasn't busy at all. My partner & I order the fresh spring rolls, combination pho, and the grilled pork chop combination. 

Nothing special about the fresh spring rolls. I honestly feel like they're all the same at every place I go to. The peanut sauce wasn't watered down though. It was nice and thick just how I like it. The combination pho came with rare steak, brisket and beef balls. When we first got it, the broth was a deep brown color. Which means they took their time on the broth. It tasted so delicious. The flavor was so meaty and yumm... probably the best pho broth I ever had!!! Others are always so light in color. Yes, price wise it's a little more than others but trust me, it's worth it!! Now lastly, the pork chop combination which came with 1 piece pork chop,
Chinese sausage & eggloaf. I was never a fan of eggloaf but once I had pho kings eggloaf I ordered another on the side. It was that great!!!!


I will be a returning customer for that pho broth & eggloaf. I highly recommend this place!!

Very much enjoyed lunch here today. Food was very well prepared, service was very attentive and place was very clean. Fried egg rolls were tasty, fresh spring rolls were delicious, and grilled beef was perfectly spiced and cooked.

Just in case you don't get the joke, the proper way to pronounce Pho is "fu" - so... Fu King.

I like the concept of being able to add the different proteins in my pho.  It's my ultimate when I get to customize my dish.  Though they don't have tripe, the quality of meat and super hot broth is just perfect.  The location is great and the price is just right.

The customer service is spot on, professional and their uniforms makes this casual place a desirable place to dine in.  I thought the amount of meat to noodles were a decent amount.  I got 3 different type of flank meat to meatballs just to get a nice variety. 

Another great addition to Henderson without having to travel to Chinatown to get a good bowl of pho. The owner left the east coast to settle here and it looks like it'll do good.

The pho came out warm. The broth was not hot and the noodles were a bit tough. Which means they left the noodles laying out which hardens it and the broth was not heated long enough. I ordered com tam to go and it was warm also. Food tasted good but preparation was mediocre.

We had the traditional Vietnamese fried egg roll and it was really good. We ordered the grilled pork combo and the seasoning is just right, the Chinese sausage and steamed egg adds a little variety to the plate. The Ox tail pho is a must to try to those who are in to exotic food. Our server Hisham is so courteous and attentive to our dining experience.
